PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Hole mobility of PCDSeBT |
| Electron mobility of PCDSeBT |
| Mobility of PC71BM |
| Blend of PCDSeBT and PC71BM (1 : 4 w/w) |
| Space-charge-limited current (SCLC) method |
| J-V characteristics |
| Figure 6 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Property Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Hole mobility of PCDSeBT |
| Electron mobility of PCDSeBT |
| Mobility of PC71BM |
| Blend of PCDSeBT and PC71BM (1 : 4 w/w) |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to material properties:

* "The hole and electron mobilities" - this is a general term that refers to the mobility of charge carriers in a material, rather than a specific material property.
* "Space-charge-limited current (SCLC) method" - this is a technique used to measure material properties, rather than a material property itself.
* "J-V characteristics" - this is a term that refers to the current-voltage characteristics of a material, which is a material property.
